parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the incapacitated sub-state of the given unit, when the [[lifeState]] of the unit is "INCAPACITATED". Could be one of:
* "UNCONSCIOUS"
* "MOVING"
* "SHOOTING"

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''incapacitatedState''' person

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> person: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] - incapacitated sub-state (see description) or empty string ""

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_result = [[incapacitatedState]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setUnconscious]] [[lifeState]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 18, 2018 - 02:53 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:HazJ|HazJ]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command returns "SHOOTING" (intentional behaviour?) when checking a unit's state while they are unconscious. Tested with BIS revive. I recommend just using the lifeState command instead.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 29, 2019 - 21:13 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Returns 
"UNCONSCIOUS" when awaiting revive.
"" when alive or when awaiting respawn. This means that when a unit dies instantly, ie through drowning, this command will return empty string throughout. As Haz says above, it sometimes show "SHOOTING" when the player is unconscious for reasons that are not clear.

</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
